context.p: To install Eucalyptus on servers running CentOS 6:

step.cmd: Configure the Eucalyptus package repository on each host that will run a Eucalyptus component:
Configure the Euca2ools package repository on each host that will run a Eucalyptus component or Euca2ools:
Configure the EPEL package repository on each host that will run a Eucalyptus component or Euca2ools:
Configure the ELRepo repository on each host that will run Walrus:

step.note: If you are a Eucalyptus subscriber, you should have received an rpm package file that you will need to install. If you are not a Eucalyptus subscriber, skip this step.
step.cmd: Install the Eucalyptus subscription package on each host that will run a Eucalyptus component:
Install the Eucalyptus cloud controller software on each planned CLC host:

step.note: Clouds that use the VMware hypervisor do not have NCs; if you plan to use VMware then skip this step.

substep.cmd: Install the KVM driver appropriate to your hardware.
Install the Eucalyptus node controller software on each planned NC host:

step.cmd: Install the software for the remaining Eucalyptus components. The following example shows most components being installed on the same host. We recommend that you use different hosts for each component:
If you have a Eucalyptus subscription and plan to use the VMware hypervisor, install the Eucalyptus VMware broker software on each CC host:
If you have a Eucalyptus subscription and plan to use SAN support, install the Eucalyptus SAN adapter software that matches your SAN adapter on each SC host:
If you are using NetApp SAN support, you will need to install NetApp specific libs packages

substep.cmd: Install the NetApp SAN libs package on each CLC host:

step.cmd: If you are using EMC SAN support, you will need to install EMC specific libs packages

substep.cmd: Install the EMC SAN libs package on each CLC host:

step.cmd: After you have installed Eucalyptus, test multicast connectivity between each CLC and Walrus, SC, and VMware broker host.

substep.cmd: Run the following receiver command on the CLC:
Once the receiver command blocks, simultaneously run the following sender command on each Walrus host:
substep.info: java -classpath /usr/share/eucalyptus/jgroups-2.11.1.Final.jar org.jgroups.tests.McastSenderTest -mcast_addr 224.10.10.10 -port 5555 The two applications should be able to connect and arbitrary lines entered on the sender should appear on the receiver.

substep.cmd: Repeat the previous step on each SC host and VMware broker host
If you are installing an HA environment, repeat these tasks with the second CLC.

taskbody.postreq: You are now ready to Configure Eucalyptus.
